intro: Smilax ovatorotunda, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It features woody stems with thorns and heart-shaped, waxy leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
